contentrichtext.text: {{ Cluster | | image = [[Image:NGC 2169.jpg|300px]] | name = NGC 2169 | type = | epoch = [[J2000]] | ra = {{RA|06|8.4}} | dec = {{DEC|+13|57}} | dist_ly = 3.6 [[Light-year#Distances in light-years|kly]] | appmag_v = 5.9 | size_v = 7′ | constellation = [[Orion (constellation)|Orion]] | radius_ly = | absmag_v = | notes = | names = }} '''NGC 2169''', is an [[open cluster]] in the [[Orion constellation]]. It was discovered by [[Giovanni Batista Hodierna]] before 1654 and discovered by [[William Herschel]] on October 15, 1784. <ref>{{cite book|last=O'Meara|first=Stephen James|title=Deep Sky Companions: Hidden Treasures|year=2007|publisher=Cambridge University Press|isbn=9780521837040|pages=180}}</ref> NGC 2169 is at a distance of about 3,600 [[light year]]s away from [[Earth]]. It is nicknamed "The '37' Cluster" due to its striking resemblance to the numerals "37." == External links == *[http://www.seds.org/messier/xtra/ngc/n2169.html SEDS entry] *[http://antwrp.gsfc.nasa.gov/apod/ap051118.html Astronomy Picture of the Day] *{{WikiSky}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Ngc25}} {{star-cluster-stub}} {{Sky|06|8.4|00|+|13|57|00|3600}} [[Category:NGC objects|2169]] [[Category:Open clusters]] [[Category:Orion (constellation)]]
